page.title: 06TOLROY HOLIDAY VILLAGE
page.content: Tolroy means tall trees in Cornish. It used to be owned by the Trevithick family. Richard Trevithick was a local inventor. Tolroy Holiday Village,open annually from Easter till September,has been in business for about twenty years and is now owned by the Haven Holiday Club. There are 178 chalets, some housing 6 to 8 people. There are three bars, two adult's and one children's bar. The biggest bar called the Trevithick Club has a stage on which entertainments are performed. One act uses a boa- constrictor. The club has a restaurant and facilities for take-away food but does not serve breakfast. The amenities include a swimming-pool, sauna, solarium, squash and tennis courts, a putting-green, an amusement arcade, shop and launderette. The facilities are not open to the public.
